intro: Saldinia pallida, commonly known as the pale saldinia, is a flowering plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, typical of the genus Saldinia. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often growing in dense tufts. Saldinia pallida is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments.
